title: Data Analyst
description:
What you’ll do
The business analyst would work closely with our customers to understand their business model, requirements and translate them into software requirements documents. Specifically, the responsibilities would include:

Understanding business process management and business requirements of the customers and translating them to specific software requirements.
Ensuring that the solution suggested is commercially viable and competitive.
Documenting and analyzing the required information and data.
Understanding the technical designs as well as the specifications.
Evaluating the information gathered through workshops and surveys, business process description and task analysis.
Effectively communicating with internal teams and external clients to deliver functional requirements like GUI, screen and interface designs.
Business intelligence and a deep understanding of customer's needs so that they can be transformed into application and operational requirements.
Acting as an interface between business units, technology teams and support teams

Desired Candidate Profile


Excellent oral and written communication
Analytical Skills
Presentation Skills
Being a leader who can create leaders
Client Management
Excellent Team worker
Need to have synergy with people and conforming to the needs of the project
Being proactive
Having passion for the job
High on commitment & cooperation
The 'get it done' approach
Good communication
Flair for learning
Innovative approach
Show more Show less

title: Data Analyst - 75% REMOTE $60k
description:
In this role, you'll be working with large, disparate data sets, developing complex reporting solutions, and streamlining processes through automation. You'll gain fluency in capital market concepts and become familiar with financial services operations.




Why join us?




We offer a comprehensive compensation package including but not limited to:




A highly competitive salary ranging from $55K-$60K
100% employer covered benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision)
401K with generous company match
Collaborative and friendly team
Lunch provided every day!
Some travel to local client offices may be required







Job Details




RESPONSIBILITIES:




Researching data issues involving large volumes of data stored in various systems
Troubleshooting problems loading data from automated data feeds
Identifying repetitive problems and developing permanent solutions
Developing a working understanding of financial concepts related to client data and reporting
Collaborating with business stakeholders and 3rd parties to develop technical solutions
Developing client-facing reports based on client requests
Using SQL to make deeper dives into complex issues to trace problems back to root cause




MUST HAVE:

1+ yrs of professional experience working as an Analyst
Experience writing SQL query language in a Database,




OR, Expertise with MS Excel V-lookups and Pivot Tables




PREFERRED:

Basic programming experience
Finance/Capital Markets/Hedge Fund industry experience
B.S. in Management Information Services, Computer Science, or similar






Show more Show less

title: Data Analyst
industries: Financial Services
description:
Core Responsibilities

Engages with internal partners to understand business strategy, questions, and goals. Brings structure to business requests, translates requirements into an analytical project approach, and supports projects through completion.
Acquires and compiles structured and unstructured data and verifies its quality, accuracy and reasonableness.
Performs analyses of historical data to surface trends and insights using analytical methods.
Prepares and delivers visualizations and internal presentations that translate analytic insights into tangible, actionable solutions for business partners to implement.
May own and manage recurring analytic or reporting processes.
Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

Minimum of three years related work experience.
Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of training and experience.

Special Factor

Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

title: Data Analyst
description:
About Mobinity Global:




Mobinity Global is a recruitment consultancy firm that helps companies such as Dell, Citadel, Qualtrics, PNC, Venture for America, RippleMatch, SAP, BNY Mellon, etc recruit faster and with more convenience.




We are transforming the way recruiting is done in the digital age. We work with a number of top-tier companies, tech startups, freelance companies, Industry professionals, and subject matter experts for projects, internships, jobs, and freelance work. 




If you meet the below eligibility criteria, please apply and our recruitment team will

connect with you to understand your strengths and strategize your career ahead. 




 We plan to build a strong connection with all of our applicants so that we can facilitate both our employment partners and potential employers now as well as in the future.




Eligibility Criteria:

Your year of graduation is 2021 or later.
Working towards a bachelor’s degree or higher from a four-year accredited university in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Market Research, Business Analytics, Information Systems, Data Science, or another heavily quantitative program from a USA university.
Must be a current student.

 

Responsibilities:




Selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques
Data mining using state-of-the-art methods
Extending company’s data with third party sources of information when needed
Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems
Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis
Doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner

Skills:

Great communication skills
Good applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.
Good scripting and programming skills
Data Savvy personality




Important: The successful application submission for the above role(s) will be conditional to your profile evaluation by our AI system. We can let you know better once you submit your resume.







Show more Show less

title: Data Analyst
industries: Computer Software
description:
Think big. Dare to innovate.







At Coates we pride ourselves on constantly challenging the industry norm to deliver unrivalled results. Switchboard™, our dynamic content management software platform, combined with our variety of digital kiosks and signage systems, offers a truly unique end to end merchandising solution. We partner with globally renowned brands and also dedicate our full attention to the needs of small to medium enterprises.







We have a passion for people and a daring willingness to do things differently. Our ambitious and collaborative team is continually focused on growing together, seizing opportunities and driving the business forward.







Supporting over 40 international markets, Coates Headquarters are based in Sydney, Australia with offices in the United States, Canada, France, China, UAE, India and Japan.







We value ideas, we deliver solutions.




PRIMARY ROLE







You will be working with Coates teams based in Australia as well as the U.S., which will require your workday to start at 1 pm CT.




As a Data Analyst, your primary responsibilities will be to conduct full lifecycle of data analysis which includes data gathering, clean-up, and analysis, in addition to report and dashboard creation. You will work with the Product, Engineering, and Delivery teams to maintain and improve their deployments at attain peak performance for our clients.







KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES




Aggregate and interrelate data from disparate sources for analysis, dashboards, reports, and insight
Perform data analysis and provide reporting and actionable insights for the key performance indicators to leadership team
Ensure quality and accuracy of data
Partner with internal teams to understand their prioritization efforts and get alignment on priorities
Partner with internal teams to understand their planned and actual capacity resource utilization, in order to represent them appropriately in the tool
Training end users on new reports and dashboards, along with tool enhancements
Identify opportunities for improvement and automation of processes, tools, and reporting







PREFERRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS




Minimum of 1 year of experience in a Data Analyst capacity
Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field
Experience using software tools to aggregate, analyze, and visualize data across disparate systems (e.g. Microsoft Power Query and Power BI, Tableau, etc.)
Expert with Microsoft Office (especially Excel and PowerPoint)
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Strong organizational, problem-solving, and analytical skills
Versatility, flexibility, and a willingness to work within constantly changing priorities with enthusiasm
Good judgment with the ability to make timely and sound recommendations
Ability to work independently and as a member of teams or committees
Effective interpersonal skills with the ability to work with all levels of management as well as the ability to deal effectively with a diversity of individuals at all levels of the organization
Creative, flexible, and innovative team player
Ability to present information effectively and respond to questions
Show more Show less

title: Data Analyst
description:
Carpe is the next generation of sweat care. We're reimagining the antiperspirant industry by creating science-backed, effective products that make sweat irrelevant. Founded by two sweaty guys, we're looking for a Data Analyst to help us reach our ambitious growth goals and join our team based in Durham, North Carolina, or remote.




This entry-level position will require a logical thinker capable of identifying insights in data. The ideal candidate is highly analytical and driven with strong attention to detail. You will be delivering analysis that will help us scale our rapidly growing business, improve customer experience, and increase operational efficiency. You will have an immediate impact on key decisions and projects with high visibility to senior leadership. This role requires a high level of independence and an ability to learn quickly.




Responsibilities

Execute research and analytics, including data sources identification, processing, data modeling, and turning insights into actionable recommendations
Perform ad-hoc and flexible analysis, deliver the BI projects for business functions.
Design research and analytic frameworks in the context of overall project objectives such as (but not limited to) media effectiveness, consumer engagement, business model optimization, etc.
Collaborate actively and effectively with other functions, partners, and leaders to accomplish project objectives.
Create and maintain documentation and processes for data integration
Proactively plan and communicate effectively up to leadership.
Manage our analytics stack, Snowflake, Daasity, & Looker.




Basic Qualifications

Bachelor's degree or above, major in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, or similar fields focused on data analytics.
Good Knowledge of Excel and SQL or Lookml
Demonstrates strong learning capability on new business knowledge, business processes, analytics tools/techniques, and methods.
Legally authorization to work in the United States




Preferred Qualifications

Has an understanding of data analysis and data strategy
Understanding of basic eCommerce operations is preferred.
Able to stay organized and work in a fast-paced environment.
Resourceful, detail-oriented, and solution-based attitude.
Effective communication skills and excellent analytical skills.




Schedule and Benefits

Target Start Date is Jan 2022
Full Time - Salaried
Salary based on experience starts at $57,000.
The office is in Durham, NC.
In-person or Hybrid work is preferred.




About Carpe

Carpe was founded in 2014 by two sweaty guys with the vision to deliver full body science-backed sweat control to keep you dry.




LIFE CAN GET SWEATY. WE KEEP YOU DRY.




We are an Equal Employment Opportunity (“EEO”) Employer. It has been and will continue to be a fundamental policy of Carpe not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, gender, gender identity, pregnancy, marital status, partnership status, domestic violence victim status, sexual orientation, age, national origin, alienage or citizenship status, veteran or military status, disability, medical condition, genetic information, caregiver status, unemployment status or any other characteristic prohibited by federal, state and/or local laws. This policy applies to all aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, demotion, compensation, training, working conditions, transfer, job assignment, benefits, layoff, and termination.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Dawn Foods is a leading global bakery manufacturing and distribution organization with 100 years of history. We built our Digital innovation Hub in Boston’s Back Bay and staffed the start-up with top talent from leading Boston eCommerce firms like BJs, Keurig, Sapient, Staples, and Wayfair. The Boston office has a broad mandate to drive the company’s digital capabilities and reports to our Boston-based Chief Digital Officer. This is a start-up opportunity to build digital capabilities from the ground up using a headless commerce architecture with the latest technologies across the digital ecosystem. 




This role reports to our Boston-based, Site Manager.

 

Requirements

2-4 years overall work experience, preferably in eCommerce or Digital marketing
Creative problem solving and troubleshooting skills; Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment with frequent production releases
Degree in Computer Science, a related field, or industry experience, preferably with certification in Google Analytics, Tableau or similar BI tools

 

Job Responsibilities

Plan, develop, and execute data-collecting strategies
Organizing and transforming information into comprehensible structures
Using data mining to extract information from data sets and identify correlations and patterns
Identify, track and act on key KPIs relevant to the business
Performing statistical analysis of data
Create visualizations for data in easy-to-understand formats, such as diagrams and graphs
Create and deliver compelling presentations that provide actionable insights and recommendations
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques, and provide ongoing reports
Work cross functionally to support product, marketing, and other internal teams with data requests
Monitoring data for quality and accuracy 
Communicating with stakeholders to understand data content and business requirements
Using data to predict trends in the customer base and the consumer population as a whole
Help coordinate projects across multiple stakeholders, appropriately prioritizing amongst competing initiatives
Skills
Productivity Tools: Microsoft Excel, Microsoft PowerPoint
Google Marketing Platform: Google Analytics, Google Tag Manger and Optimize
Web Development: HTML, JavaScript, CSS
Databases: SQL
Reporting/Visualization: Google Data Studio, Tableau, or SAP BI

 

Here at Dawn, our crisis management team is meeting regularly to assess our response to COVID-19. As part of this, we are looking at potential changes in our interview and onboarding process, as your health and safety is of the utmost importance to us. We encourage you to check back frequently and know that recruiters will be in touch with candidates as needed. We appreciate your interest in becoming part of the Dawn Family and will continue to make updates as new information becomes available. 

 

Thank you, 

Dawn Recruitment Team

title: Data Analyst
description:
Modelshop is looking for a data and modeling analyst to join our growing team. The chosen candidate will work closely with clients to design and build automated analytic applications using Modelshop's no-code automation platform. Examples of automated analytic applications include real-time credit decision models, fraud detection tools, medical treatment optimization and IT management models.

The right candidate will be technically oriented and able to rapidly learn new business domains and solve challenging analytic problems in multiple industries. Formal programming experience is not required, but the candidate must be familiar with data modeling concepts and comfortable creating logic syntax in tools such as business intelligence, reporting, advanced Excel or scripting languages. Some experience with Python, R or SAS is a plus.

title: Data Analyst, Entry-Level
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet Publishing
description:
About The Team

At DoorDash, we’re building the future of on-demand delivery. Our world-class team of Data Scientists is passionate about creating opportunities for others to become the next generation of data-driven decision-makers at DoorDash. Many of our best Data Scientists had no experience prior to transferring into the role. This is an excellent opportunity to jumpstart your Analytics career.

About The Role

Our goal is to develop our entry-level Data Analysts into thoughtful and strategic leaders. This means designing and running experiments in your first quarter at DoorDash, quickly becoming a SQL expert, developing your data storytelling abilities, and working alongside seasoned data scientists who will guide you in developing necessary skills on the job. As a Data Analyst at DoorDash, you'll use your quantitative reasoning skills to dive into large datasets to guide decision-making. We tackle a multitude of exciting challenges including customer acquisition, fraud, and support, marketing, balancing supply and demand, new city launches, marketplace efficiency, and more. If you enjoy finding patterns amidst chaos and want to learn how to use analytics to affect revenue, growth, operations, or beyond, we’re looking for someone like you!

You’re Excited About This Opportunity Because You Will…

Get your start in Analytics and learn the ropes from seasoned Data Scientists. You’ll have important problems to solve from day one.
Use quantitative analysis and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand what drives our business.
Own the end-to-end experimentation process from opportunity identification and experimentation design to analyzing results and recommending next steps.
Build full-cycle analytics experiments, reports, and dashboards using SQL, R, Python, or other scripting and statistical tools.
Produce recommendations and use exploratory data analysis techniques to validate your findings.
Provide insights to help business and product leaders understand marketplace dynamics, user behaviors, and long-term trends.
Identify and measure product and business levers to focus our roadmap on moving key metrics
Work backward from understanding and sizing problems to ideating solutions
Report against our goals by identifying essential metrics and building executive-facing dashboards to track progress
Collaborate with engineering to implement, document, validate, and monitor our logging
Be a part of DoorDash’s first entry-level Analytics program!

We’re Excited About You Because…

A degree in Math, Physics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Biology, Chemistry, or equivalent exposure to a quantitative domain
Curiosity about our business and products, and how we can improve them using data, analysis, and experimentation
High-level understanding of analytical concepts like funnel optimization, user segmentation, cohort analyses, time series analyses, regression models, etc
Basic knowledge of a data or scripting language (e.g., SQL, Python, R, matlab, etc.) and the desire to quickly develop mastery of SQL
Basic working knowledge of data manipulation and visualization techniques
Familiarity with statistical concepts related to experiment design, hypothesis testing, and predictive modeling
The insight to take ambiguous problems and solve them in a structured, hypothesis-driven, data-supported way
The determination to initiate and lead projects to completion in a scrappy environment
Prior experience, including internships, in data analytics, consulting, or related quantitative role is a plus but not required

Why You’ll Love Working at DoorDash

We are leaders – Leadership is not limited to our management team. It’s something everyone at DoorDash embraces and embodies.

We are operators – We believe the only way to predict the future is to build it. Creating solutions to lead our company and our industry is what we do on every project, every day.

We are learners – Everyone here is continually learning on the job, no matter if we’ve been in a role for one year or one minute. We are committed to learning and implementing what is best for our customers, merchants, and dashers.

We are one team – The magic of DoorDash is our people, together making our inspiring goals attainable and driving us to greater heights.

About DoorDash

At DoorDash, our mission to empower local economies shapes how our team members move quickly and always learn and reiterate to support merchants, Dashers and the communities we serve. We are a technology and logistics company that started with door-to-door delivery, and we are looking for team members who can help us go from a company that is known for delivering food to a company that people turn to for any and all goods. Read more on the DoorDash website, the DoorDash blog, the DoorDash Engineering blog, and the DoorDash Careers page.DoorDash is growing rapidly and changing constantly, which gives our team members the opportunity to share their unique perspectives, solve new challenges, and own their careers. Our leaders seek the truth and welcome big, hairy, audacious questions. We are grounded in our company values, and we make intentional decisions that are both logical and display empathy for our range of users—from Dashers to Merchants to Customers.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, and any other state or local hiring regulations, we will consider for employment any qualified applicant, including those with arrest and conviction records, in a manner consistent with the applicable regulation.

Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, the base salary range in Colorado for this position is $86,000 to $129,000 per year, plus opportunities for equity and commission. Compensation in other geographies may vary. We're committed to supporting employees’ happiness, healthiness, and overall well-being by providing comprehensive benefits and perks including premium healthcare, wellness expense reimbursement, paid parental leave and more.

We're committed to supporting employees’ happiness, healthiness, and overall well-being by providing comprehensive benefits and perks including premium healthcare, wellness expense reimbursement, paid parental leave and more.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel. Statement of Non-Discrimination: In keeping with our beliefs and goals, no employee or applicant will face discrimination or harassment based on: race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital/domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability status, or veteran status. Above and beyond discrimination and harassment based on “protected categories,” we also strive to prevent other subtler forms of inappropriate behavior (i.e., stereotyping) from ever gaining a foothold in our office. Whether blatant or hidden, barriers to success have no place at DoorDash. We value a diverse workforce – people who identify as women, non-binary or gender non-conforming, LGBTQIA+, American Indian or Native Alaskan, Black or African American, Hispanic or Latinx, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander, differently-abled, caretakers and parents, and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. Thank you to the Level Playing Field Institute for this statement of non-discrimination.If you need any accommodations, please inform your recruiting contact upon initial connection.

Read more on the DoorDash website, the DoorDash blog, the DoorDash Engineering blog, and the DoorDash Careers page.DoorDash is growing rapidly and changing constantly, which gives our team members the opportunity to share their unique perspectives, solve new challenges, and own their careers. We are a technology and logistics company that started with door-to-door delivery, and we are looking for team members who can help us go from a company that is known for delivering food to a company that people turn to for any and all goods. Read more on the DoorDash website, the DoorDash blog, the DoorDash Engineering blog, and the DoorDash Careers page.DoorDash is growing rapidly and changing constantly, which gives our team members the opportunity to share their unique perspectives, solve new challenges, and own their careers. Our leaders seek the truth and welcome big, hairy, audacious questions. We are grounded in our company values, and we make intentional decisions that are both logical and display empathy for our range of users—from Dashers to Merchants to Customers.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, and any other state or local hiring regulations, we will consider for employment any qualified applicant, including those with arrest and conviction records, in a manner consistent with the applicable regulation.

Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, the base salary range in Colorado for this position is $86,000 to $129,000 per year, plus opportunities for equity and commission. Compensation in other geographies may vary. We're committed to supporting employees’ happiness, healthiness, and overall well-being by providing comprehensive benefits and perks including premium healthcare, wellness expense reimbursement, paid parental leave and more.

We're committed to supporting employees’ happiness, healthiness, and overall well-being by providing comprehensive benefits and perks including premium healthcare, wellness expense reimbursement, paid parental leave and more.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel. Statement of Non-Discrimination: In keeping with our beliefs and goals, no employee or applicant will face discrimination or harassment based on: race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital/domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability status, or veteran status. Above and beyond discrimination and harassment based on “protected categories,” we also strive to prevent other subtler forms of inappropriate behavior (i.e., stereotyping) from ever gaining a foothold in our office. Whether blatant or hidden, barriers to success have no place at DoorDash. We value a diverse workforce – people who identify as women, non-binary or gender non-conforming, LGBTQIA+, American Indian or Native Alaskan, Black or African American, Hispanic or Latinx, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander, differently-abled, caretakers and parents, and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. Thank you to the Level Playing Field Institute for this statement of non-discrimination.If you need any accommodations, please inform your recruiting contact upon initial connection.

title: Data Analyst
description:
About Mobinity Global:




Mobinity Global is a recruitment consultancy firm that helps companies such as Dell, Citadel, Qualtrics, PNC, Venture for America, RippleMatch, SAP, etc recruit faster and with more convenience.




We are  transforming the way recruiting is done in the digital age. We work with a number of top tier companies, tech startups, freelance companies, industry professionals and subject matter experts for projects, internships, jobs and freelance work. 




If you meet the below eligibility criteria, please apply and our recruitment team will connect with you to understand your strengths and strategize your career ahead. 




We plan to build a strong connection with all of our applicants so that we can facilitate both our employment partners and potential employees now as well as in the future.




Eligibility Criteria:

Your year of graduation is 2021 or later. 

You have a bachelor's degree from a USA university.




Duties and responsibility:

Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
 Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities

Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy

title: Game Data Analyst, Kids Games
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Computer Software, and Internet Publishing
description:
Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Amazon Kids+ is growing exponentially. What began as a small, parent-friendly experiment in children’s multimedia content, has quickly become the top kids-only media subscription in the world. The Kids+ team is looking for a dynamic, creative, and efficient Game Data Analyst to help inform the optimization and development of engaging mobile games for our Kids+ audience. This person will contribute to mobile games from concept to launch and live service, with responsibility for delivering strategic insights and best in class game data reporting.

Join us as we build the next generation of safe, fun, and healthy kids content.

Key job responsibilities

Leverage expertise in SQL and visualization tools to provide best in class game data analysis and reporting
Translate large, complex data sets into actionable insights for game improvements
Collaborate with Producers and Product Managers to tune numerical design of game features based on your analysis
Create automated processes to maximize time spent on high value data initiatives
Drive roadmap for monthly/quarterly data research projects
Build from scratch and expand on existing data schemas to ensure data pipelines are optimized and data gaps are plugged over time
Proactively surface new game, game feature and business opportunities
Collaborate with cross functional team members including producers, engineering, marketing and legal


Basic Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree in relevant field (e.g. Engineering, Statistics, Business, Economics, Data Science)
3-5+ years of experience in data analysis / digital product management
Expertise in SQL and data visualization
Excellent communication and presentation skills

Preferred Qualifications

Passion for and previous experience in children’s content
Passion for video games and mobile games
2+ years of experience supporting multiple live titles simultaneously

title: New Graduate Data Analyst
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Marketing and Advertising, and Computer Software
description:
Overview

About the Organization:

Discovery Direct-to-Consumer is the technology arm of Discovery Inc.

We work at the crossroads of technology, entertainment, and everyday utility, continuously leveraging technology to create immersive viewing and interactive experiences. We are building a global streaming video platform and a suite of applications to support all our global Discovery owned brands. These include DiscoveryGo, Food Network Plus, GolfTV, MotorTrend on Demand, Eurosport Player, Discovery plus, and many more. We build experiences ranging from traditional video streaming, to highly interactive and immersive applications. We build across connected TV, web, mobile and consoles and are fast, nimble and have fun building world-class products for our iconic brands.

About the Team:

The Data Science and Analytics team is focused on driving better understanding of our customers through data and scientific methods. We do so by collecting data, applying business logic to the data and converting that data into reports and insights. We also leverage machine learning to improve the customer experience across our products. We are an end-to-end analytics team, and have skills within the team to ingest, collect, clean, transform data and explore, report, build models and communicate with internal and external stakeholders to make meaningful impact in the organization.

Why Join the Discovery Team?

Discovery’s Direct-to- Consumer team offers a truly unique experience. As a Graduate Data Scientist, you’ll make an almost immediate impact, helping to create world class global streaming products and the platform that powers them. You’ll be able to build features that help to refine the modern viewing experience for millions. We’re a global team, but with many of the benefits of working in a start-up environment, building from the ground up. We encourage our scientists to take educated risks, we celebrate mistakes, and we learn from them as a team. You’ll also work with and learn from highly talented data scientists, using cutting-edge technology to deliver immense value for passionate superfans around the world. We have a genuinely open culture and expect great ideas to come from everyone and look forward to the fresh perspective and new ideas our graduates bring!

Key Features of the Program:

Project Assignments: Individuals joining the program will gain experience building world-class, innovative consumer facing products and features, for globally recognized entertainment brands, consumed by millions of superfans across the globe, using the news technologies and methodologies.
Onboarding and Bootcamp: Our bootcamp is designed to accelerate impact, by immersing our graduates in all things Discovery Direct-to-Consumer. It’s an opportunity to establish your network and lay a foundation that allows you to confidently dive into the complex challenges you’ll be solving everyday.
Mentorship Program: You’ll be aligned with a mentor who will act as a guide and informally help you navigate your first year as a Data Scientist, grow your network, and gain exposure to areas of interest outside of your day-to-day.
Career Coaching: During your first months here, you’ll receive tailored career advice and guidance from experienced DS’s, and leaders who have been where you are, and will share useful tips and insights into how they have successfully navigated their careers.
Global Network and Opportunities: Our Data team works across different regions, countries, and cultures to create a seamless experience for our customers regardless of geography. This program will provide organic and structured opportunities to build effective and meaningful relationships with fellow DS’s from across the globe.
Accelerated Growth: We’ve brought together a team of the industry’s best to re-imagine the viewing experience and build phenomenal products and experiences from the ground up. As the newest members of the team, you’ll experience continuous growth and development and ultimately have the opportunity to determine and pursue the type of work that excites and challenges you.
Compensation: Competitive base salary, incentive bonus, and comprehensive benefits package.


What you need to know about the DTC New Graduate 2022 Program Application Process:

Our Program starts on July 25th, 2022.
This is a full-time, salaried role.
The application deadline is January 1st, 2022. After this date, we cannot guarantee your application will be reviewed for the position.
We do not require a cover letter. Please demonstrate your passion for the position through your resume.


We are interviewing through early 2022. A Discovery DTC Tech team member will contact you if your experiences and interests match an open New Grad position. Due to the high volume of applications, we are unable to give individual status updates.

Responsibilities

What you will do:

Create world-class global streaming products and the platform that powers them.
Develop your area of expertise on the features and services you help build along with a group of talented Data Scientists.
Take end to end ownership of product features and own the technical and operational excellence of these products.
Contribute to the product and services development process; Design and test your own hypothesis by collecting and measuring data.


Qualifications

What We're Looking For:

In addition to academic qualifications, we look for proactive problem solvers, motivated to learn and able to collaborate and exchange ideas and most importantly be a team player.
Degree in Data Science or related field.
Data experience coding in a general-purpose programming language.
Prior Intern experience as a DS in a consumer-focused company.
Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis.
Effective communication skills in both verbal and written communication.
Experience in at least one of the following languages (Java, C/C++, Python, GoLang, Swift or Javascript).
Desire to work on a diverse team.
Knowledge of distributed systems, mobile and OTT client apps, video streaming, codecs, video delivery and broadcast workflows is a big plus.
Must be a current student graduating by June 2022.
Must have at least a 3.0 GPA.
Must have the legal right to work in the United States.

title: Data Analyst (Rising Junior) Intern 2022– Chief Analytics Office
industries: Computer Hardware Manufacturing
description:
Introduction

At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.

Your Role and Responsibilities

This position is a Data Analyst Intern role with the Chief Analytics Office for rising junior students (currently in their 2nd year of university). This is part one of a two-year summer internship program, aimed at placing candidates into full-time consultant or data scientist roles upon graduation.

During this internship you will develop and be able to showcase skills in (but not limited to):


data exploration, extraction and manipulation
fact-based quantitative analysis using data visualization techniques
building innovative statistical models
interpreting output and performance of models in business terms, communicating findings to the team and stakeholders through presentation
collaborating in a team environment


We encourage interns to work from our New York metropolitan area or Research Triangle Park locations, but are open to remote work. Additional detail will be discussed throughout the interview process.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

To qualify for this position, you must possess the following:


You are pursuing a BA/BS in Economics, Business, Data Science, Engineering or another STEM field
Your expected graduation date is between December 2023 & June 2024
You have experience and/or coursework in business analytics, data analytics, econometrics, computer science, statistics, linear algebra
You have a strong interest in Data Science and analytics projects
You have the ability to think strategically about business, product and technical challenges
You have the ability to develop new problem-solving techniques to build insights
You have experience with Python, R or another programming language or software
You have experience with extracting insights from data sets by reshaping, summarization, combining, and sub-setting to extract summaries and data visualizations
You have demonstrated a strong desire to learn new skills and showcase persistence
You have advanced oral and written communication skills
You thrive in a collaborative team environment


Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise

Additional consideration will be given for these optional qualifications:


You have advanced proficiency with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
You have familiarity with statistical modeling and machine learning
You have demonstrated ability to think about business and technical challenges in an enterprise setting
Good presentation and communication skills with the ability to explain complex analytical concepts to people from other fields


About Business Unit

The IBM Chief Analytics Office is an elite analytics consulting team that is tasked by IBM executives to pursue our most complex strategic issues. Our work is a combination of data science and management consulting. Through state of the art technology and the power of artificial intelligence we strive to improve traditional business decision-making and processes.

This job requires you to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated prior to your start date, where legally permissible. Proof of vaccination status will be required. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical, pregnancy or religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable law.

Your Life @ IBM

Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.

About IBM

IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Location Statement

Supplemental 1 employees may be eligible for paid holidays, paid sick time and Employee Stock Purchase Plan.

IBM will not be providing visa sponsorship for this position now or in the future. Therefore, in order to be considered for this position, you must have the ability to work without a need for current or future visa sponsorship.

We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.

Being You @ IBM

IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

description:
OpenSponsorship is the largest digital marketplace making it easy for brands to partner with athletes. We have 10,000+ athletes across 160 sports (including over 50% of the NFL and NBA) and support clients like Anheuser Busch, Sperry, FanDuel, and CBS. We’re backed by VCs, 500 Startups, and Angel Investors like NBA All-Star Baron Davis.




We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our team. This is a cross-functional role where you will interact with members of the sales, marketing, engineering, operations and product team. Our ideal candidate will have a solid quantitative background, experience in data manipulation and visualization and will always strive to learn and improve.

 

Responsibilities

Work closely with our marketing, business, engineering, and product teams to track KPIs and identify areas of growth
Perform exploratory data analysis to gain deep understanding of how the data will advise the business decision
Present to executive and non-technical audience and uncover insights by telling compelling stories with data and visualizations
Building internal tools that support the analytical need of functional data analysis 
Maintain and support our existing data ETL pipeline and data analytics tools, including Google Analytics, Mixpanel, and etc
Design and development of dashboards and data visualization views
Continuously look for ways to improve, automate, and scale the current data process and analytics capabilities




Qualifications

1+ years of highly analytical experience in data analytics or business intelligence
Bachelor’s degree in technical or quantitative fields such as Analytics, Mathematics, Engineering, and Computer science
Advanced SQL skills. Proficiency in Python (pandas) with an emphasis on data manipulation and visualization is strongly preferred.
Proficient in data visualization tool such as Tableau
Experience with non-relational database such as MongoDB  is a plus
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Detail-oriented and highly organized
Ability to adapt and thrive in a fast-paced environment

title: Data Analyst, Entry-Level
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet Publishing
description:
About The Team

At DoorDash, we’re building the future of on-demand delivery. Our world-class team of Data Scientists is passionate about creating opportunities for others to become the next generation of data-driven decision-makers at DoorDash. Many of our best Data Scientists had no experience prior to transferring into the role. This is an excellent opportunity to jumpstart your Analytics career.

About The Role

Our goal is to develop our entry-level Data Analysts into thoughtful and strategic leaders. This means designing and running experiments in your first quarter at DoorDash, quickly becoming a SQL expert, developing your data storytelling abilities, and working alongside seasoned data scientists who will guide you in developing necessary skills on the job. As a Data Analyst at DoorDash, you'll use your quantitative reasoning skills to dive into large datasets to guide decision-making. We tackle a multitude of exciting challenges including customer acquisition, fraud, and support, marketing, balancing supply and demand, new city launches, marketplace efficiency, and more. If you enjoy finding patterns amidst chaos and want to learn how to use analytics to affect revenue, growth, operations, or beyond, we’re looking for someone like you!

You’re Excited About This Opportunity Because You Will…

Get your start in Analytics and learn the ropes from seasoned Data Scientists. You’ll have important problems to solve from day one.
Use quantitative analysis and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand what drives our business.
Own the end-to-end experimentation process from opportunity identification and experimentation design to analyzing results and recommending next steps.
Build full-cycle analytics experiments, reports, and dashboards using SQL, R, Python, or other scripting and statistical tools.
Produce recommendations and use exploratory data analysis techniques to validate your findings.
Provide insights to help business and product leaders understand marketplace dynamics, user behaviors, and long-term trends.
Identify and measure product and business levers to focus our roadmap on moving key metrics
Work backward from understanding and sizing problems to ideating solutions
Report against our goals by identifying essential metrics and building executive-facing dashboards to track progress
Collaborate with engineering to implement, document, validate, and monitor our logging
Be a part of DoorDash’s first entry-level Analytics program!

We’re Excited About You Because…

A degree in Math, Physics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Biology, Chemistry, or equivalent exposure to a quantitative domain
Curiosity about our business and products, and how we can improve them using data, analysis, and experimentation
High-level understanding of analytical concepts like funnel optimization, user segmentation, cohort analyses, time series analyses, regression models, etc
Basic knowledge of a data or scripting language (e.g., SQL, Python, R, matlab, etc.) and the desire to quickly develop mastery of SQL
Basic working knowledge of data manipulation and visualization techniques
Familiarity with statistical concepts related to experiment design, hypothesis testing, and predictive modeling
The insight to take ambiguous problems and solve them in a structured, hypothesis-driven, data-supported way
The determination to initiate and lead projects to completion in a scrappy environment
Prior experience, including internships, in data analytics, consulting, or related quantitative role is a plus but not required

Why You’ll Love Working at DoorDash

We are leaders – Leadership is not limited to our management team. It’s something everyone at DoorDash embraces and embodies.

We are operators – We believe the only way to predict the future is to build it. Creating solutions to lead our company and our industry is what we do on every project, every day.

We are learners – Everyone here is continually learning on the job, no matter if we’ve been in a role for one year or one minute. We are committed to learning and implementing what is best for our customers, merchants, and dashers.

We are one team – The magic of DoorDash is our people, together making our inspiring goals attainable and driving us to greater heights.

About DoorDash

At DoorDash, our mission to empower local economies shapes how our team members move quickly and always learn and reiterate to support merchants, Dashers and the communities we serve. description:
Must-haves

3+ years of experience in a data analyst or digital analytics environment 

Advanced with writing SQL queries

Experience analyzing data in a web or mobile application

Proficient with Adobe and Tableau

Excellent communication skills and a team player

Bachelor’s degree

 

Plusses

ThoughtSpot

 

Day-to-Day

Insight Global is looking for a Data Analyst to join a robust Consumer Digital Analytics team for a large telecom client. This person will start working remote, but is expected to be local to the office to potentially go on-site on an as needed basis once Covid-19 is over. On a day to day candidates will be working in a team environment to support the service engagement web and mobile applications. He or she will be analyzing data and reporting on consumer driven data. Candidates will be writing queries and manipulating and requesting data in a database. title: Data Analyst, Entry-Level
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet Publishing
description:
About The Team

At DoorDash, we’re building the future of on-demand delivery. Our world-class team of Data Scientists is passionate about creating opportunities for others to become the next generation of data-driven decision-makers at DoorDash. Many of our best Data Scientists had no experience prior to transferring into the role. This is an excellent opportunity to jumpstart your Analytics career.

About The Role

Our goal is to develop our entry-level Data Analysts into thoughtful and strategic leaders. This means designing and running experiments in your first quarter at DoorDash, quickly becoming a SQL expert, developing your data storytelling abilities, and working alongside seasoned data scientists who will guide you in developing necessary skills on the job. As a Data Analyst at DoorDash, you'll use your quantitative reasoning skills to dive into large datasets to guide decision-making. We tackle a multitude of exciting challenges including customer acquisition, fraud, and support, marketing, balancing supply and demand, new city launches, marketplace efficiency, and more. If you enjoy finding patterns amidst chaos and want to learn how to use analytics to affect revenue, growth, operations, or beyond, we’re looking for someone like you!

You’re Excited About This Opportunity Because You Will…

Get your start in Analytics and learn the ropes from seasoned Data Scientists. You’ll have important problems to solve from day one.
Use quantitative analysis and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand what drives our business.
Own the end-to-end experimentation process from opportunity identification and experimentation design to analyzing results and recommending next steps.
Build full-cycle analytics experiments, reports, and dashboards using SQL, R, Python, or other scripting and statistical tools.
Produce recommendations and use exploratory data analysis techniques to validate your findings.
Provide insights to help business and product leaders understand marketplace dynamics, user behaviors, and long-term trends.
Identify and measure product and business levers to focus our roadmap on moving key metrics
Work backward from understanding and sizing problems to ideating solutions
Report against our goals by identifying essential metrics and building executive-facing dashboards to track progress
Collaborate with engineering to implement, document, validate, and monitor our logging
Be a part of DoorDash’s first entry-level Analytics program!

We’re Excited About You Because…

A degree in Math, Physics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Biology, Chemistry, or equivalent exposure to a quantitative domain
Curiosity about our business and products, and how we can improve them using data, analysis, and experimentation
High-level understanding of analytical concepts like funnel optimization, user segmentation, cohort analyses, time series analyses, regression models, etc
Basic knowledge of a data or scripting language (e.g., SQL, Python, R, matlab, etc.) and the desire to quickly develop mastery of SQL
Basic working knowledge of data manipulation and visualization techniques
Familiarity with statistical concepts related to experiment design, hypothesis testing, and predictive modeling
The insight to take ambiguous problems and solve them in a structured, hypothesis-driven, data-supported way
The determination to initiate and lead projects to completion in a scrappy environment
Prior experience, including internships, in data analytics, consulting, or related quantitative role is a plus but not required

Why You’ll Love Working at DoorDash

We are leaders – Leadership is not limited to our management team. It’s something everyone at DoorDash embraces and embodies.

We are operators – We believe the only way to predict the future is to build it. Creating solutions to lead our company and our industry is what we do on every project, every day.

We are learners – Everyone here is continually learning on the job, no matter if we’ve been in a role for one year or one minute. We are committed to learning and implementing what is best for our customers, merchants, and dashers.

We are one team – The magic of DoorDash is our people, together making our inspiring goals attainable and driving us to greater heights.

About DoorDash

At DoorDash, our mission to empower local economies shapes how our team members move quickly and always learn and reiterate to support merchants, Dashers and the communities we serve. We are a technology and logistics company that started with door-to-door delivery, and we are looking for team members who can help us go from a company that is known for delivering food to a company that people turn to for any and all goods. Read more on the DoorDash website, the DoorDash blog, the DoorDash Engineering blog, and the DoorDash Careers page.DoorDash is growing rapidly and changing constantly, which gives our team members the opportunity to share their unique perspectives, solve new challenges, and own their careers. Our leaders seek the truth and welcome big, hairy, audacious questions. We are grounded in our company values, and we make intentional decisions that are both logical and display empathy for our range of users—from Dashers to Merchants to Customers.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, and any other state or local hiring regulations, we will consider for employment any qualified applicant, including those with arrest and conviction records, in a manner consistent with the applicable regulation.

Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, the base salary range in Colorado for this position is $86,000 to $129,000 per year, plus opportunities for equity and commission. Compensation in other geographies may vary. We're committed to supporting employees’ happiness, healthiness, and overall well-being by providing comprehensive benefits and perks including premium healthcare, wellness expense reimbursement, paid parental leave and more.

We're committed to supporting employees’ happiness, healthiness, and overall well-being by providing comprehensive benefits and perks including premium healthcare, wellness expense reimbursement, paid parental leave and more.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel. Above and beyond discrimination and harassment based on “protected categories,” we also strive to prevent other subtler forms of inappropriate behavior (i.e., stereotyping) from ever gaining a foothold in our office. Whether blatant or hidden, barriers to success have no place at DoorDash. title: Data Analyst
description:
Data Analyst




Who We Are:

Deduce is a fast growing, venture capital backed Cybersecurity startup on the forefront of empowering a more efficient, resilient, and effective cybersecurity industry. We’re building products, big data infrastructure, and APIs that identify fraudulent account activity and compromise - powering businesses and developers to stop fraud in its tracks. Our leadership team has a history of proven success prior to launching Deduce. They’ve grown, built and gone through 4 acquisitions and recently raised a Series A that will propel us into a hyper stage of growth. If you have a passion for cybersecurity, accessibility, or positive impact – we are your people and now is the time to join us.




About the role:

In this role you’ll collaborate with cutting edge data scientists, data engineers, and work closely with customers to prove business value, create visualizations, enhance product features, and validate data models. This is a limited opportunity to join at this early stage and have an immediate impact on the trajectory and growth of our business as we scale. Your work will help to enhance fraud detection models on our big data platform that protects businesses and customers from unauthorized account access, data leakage, and identity fraud.




Responsibilities:

• Become an expert in the Deduce platform, products, and APIs

• Work collaboratively with Customers, Product, and Engineering

• Perform data analytics using Python to meet business requirements

• Work closely with the Data Science team to perform exploratory data analysis and data

transformation in Python

• Develop and schedule processes to extract, transform, normalize, and store data from

various systems

• Apply new perspectives, creative problem solving, multi-functional connections, and

data visualization standard methodologies to improve analytical capabilities

• Build innovative reports, dashboards, forecasts, and presentations to tell data stories

and proof-of-concepts

• Work with customer data to report on and complete evaluations / proof-of-concepts;

calculating efficacy and ROI

• Research and implement new technologies for the purposes of improving our data pipeline and architecture

• Evangelize data stewardship, pursue data quality, and relentlessly drive data issues to resolution

Requirements:

• Degree in Statistics, Data Science, Machine Learning, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, or related field

• 3+ years of progressively responsible experience in hands-on data analysis; application of analytical techniques and development of robust data solutions

• Proficient in data visualization and other analytical tools and libraries

• High proficiency in Python / Pandas

• Proven aptitude and desire to learn new technology platforms; development, analytical and presentation tools; as well as data modeling, analytical and statistical techniques

• Experience in fraud prevention / cybersecurity in ecommerce, fintech, banking or for a fraud solution product is a plus

• Exposure to scalable real-time systems in a production environment is a plus

• Ability to work as an effective, collaborative member within a small team environment – we all get our hands dirty and are excited about building something for the first time

• Proven success as both a self-starter and a considerate team player




Benefits:

• Remote-first culture – we’re a distributed team located across the US and Canada

• Premium health care benefits – 100% paid for employee and dependents

• 401K

• Stock-options




Deduce is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). We encourage and strongly support workplace diversity and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Show more Show less

title: Data Analyst
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Computer and Network Security, and Internet Publishing
description:
About Us

At Cloudflare, we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world’s largest networks that powers approximately 25 million Internet properties, for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine’s Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World’s Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.

We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!

About The Department

Cloudflare is looking to build and grow our data analytics/business intelligence team that will be responsible for building a large-scale enterprise modern data lake and EDW that combines massive petabyte scale traffic logs with data from various business systems supporting product, marketing, customer support, sales, finance etc. and enabling easier consumption of that data using tools to drive standard reporting, adhoc/exploratory analytics and advanced insights using data science models.

About The Role

As part of this initiative, we are looking for a strong data analyst to come join Cloudflare and help us drive analytic insights and best practices at scale from the ground up. Success in this role comes from marrying a strong data background with acute product and business acumen to deliver highly strategic and compelling insights that accelerate our business growth and influence our product decisions within Cloudflare.

What we look for: Data analysis, Business Analysis, Storytelling, Strong Business & Product Acumen, Cross-functional Collaboration, Creative Problem Solving, Agile

What you'll do

Fundamental understanding of the data landscape i.e tooling, tech stack, source systems etc. and work closely with the Data Engineering team to improve the data collection and quality.
Understand business/product strategy and high-level roadmap and align analysis efforts to enable them with data insights and help achieve their strategic goals.
Audience focused presentation and storytelling skills focused on key takeaways and recommendations in a crisp and concise manner.
Ability to define and spot macro and micro levels trends with statistical significance on a regular basis and understand key drivers driving those trends.

Examples Of Desirable Skills, Knowledge And Experience

Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering or related experience required.
Data analyst experience ideally in a large scale environment (PBs scale, globally distributed teams).
Proven results oriented analysis that helped support positive change in the business strategy.
Experience in Python, R, SQL, Tableau, Google Analytics, Hive and BigQuery (or any other Big data/Cloud equivalent) etc.
Capable of working closely with business including but not limited to, Engineering, Sales, Marketing, and Product teams to ensure data initiatives are aligned with business needs and is of high quality.
Experience with a fast-growing SaaS business based company is preferred.

What Makes Cloudflare Special?

We’re not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We’re a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.

Project Galileo : We equip politically and artistically important organizations and journalists with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare’s enterprise customers--at no cost.

Athenian Project : We created Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration.

Path Forward Partnership : Since 2016, we have partnered with Path Forward, a nonprofit organization, to create 16-week positions for mid-career professionals who want to get back to the workplace after taking time off to care for a child, parent, or loved one.

1.1.1.1 : We released 1.1.1.1 to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here’s the deal - we don’t store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our privacy commitment and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.

Sound like something you’d like to be a part of? We’d love to hear from you!

This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.

Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.

Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at hr@cloudflare.com or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.

title: Data Analyst
description:
About Mobinity Global:




Mobinity Global is a recruitment consultancy firm that helps companies such as Dell, Citadel, Qualtrics, PNC, Venture for America, RippleMatch, SAP, etc recruit faster and with more convenience.




We are transforming the way recruiting is done in the digital age. We work with a number of top tier companies, tech startups, freelance companies, industry professionals and subject matter experts for projects, internships, jobs and freelance work. 




If you meet the below eligibility criteria, please apply and our recruitment team will

connect with you to understand your strengths and strategize your career ahead. 




We plan to build a strong connection with all of our applicants so that we can facilitate both our employment partners and potential employees now as well as in the future.




Eligibility Criteria:

Your year of graduation is 2021 or later. 

You have a bachelor's degree from a USA university.




Duties and responsibility:

Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
 Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities

 Requirements:

Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy







Note: The successful application submission for the above role(s) will be conditional to your profile evaluation by our AI system. We can let you know better once you submit your resume.

title: Data Analyst
description:
12-18 month contract that is remote until further notice then will be a hybrid schedule. You will receive full benefits (vision, dental, health, HSA, 401k, and more!)




You must be located in or around the following cities to be considered:

Charlotte, NC
Des Moines, IA,
Minneapolis, MN
San Antonio, TX
Chandler, AZ




Job Description:

In general, you will use SQL or SAS to search one of the "big four" bank's financial database to view, analyze, and draw conclusions from data you didn't collect and haven't seen before. From this, you will need to create a story that that will be presented for use in different applications based on which department / path you are placed in.
Not a developer role.
Will get placed into 1 of 4 paths:
Exploratory analytics – deep dives into data sources, analytics strategy.
Remediation analytics – develop strategy for population or impacts around remediation.
Inline quality – parallel testing of remediation analytics / strategy.
Transactional testing - developing audit ready transactional verification data, testing transactions in data, pulling small snippets of code to test data to see what they pull back to confirm accuracy of data.




Required Qualifications:

Experience with SAS or SQL for 3 years or more in a professional work setting.
Detailed Data Analysis / Data Strategy / Data Modeling / Data Reporting – ability to look at data you have never seen before to draw conclusions and question what you are seeing.
Great communication skills with all levels in an organization (i.e. peers, leaders, supervisors, subordinates).
Critical thinking skills.
Ability to document processes.
4+ years of professional work experience in one or a combination of the following: data reporting, data analytics, or data modeling.




Preferred Skills (not required):

Jira.
Finance/ banking industry experience.
Deep experience working with complex data in multiple data systems/fields.
Data science background, forensic analytics.
Data root cause issues.
Understanding of consumer lending data and analytics.
Reporting and analytics experience.
Master's Degree

title: Data Analyst
description:
Branded Research Inc., (Branded) is looking for a motivated and experienced Data Analyst in a role for a fast-growing company in the ResTech space This is a critical role which will require the candidate will help us turn data into information, information into insights, and insights into business decisions. This is a full time position.




ABOUT Branded

Branded is a leading audience and insights solutions company that helps clients make more informed marketing and product development decisions. Through proven and innovative methods, as well as proprietary technologies like Branded Surveys, Branded Research is able to actively engage with consumers and reach specified target audiences, resulting in more precise and complete end data. We take a unique, communicative approach. Our audience was founded on core principles of social engagement and the power of the simple conversation. It's what sets us apart from the rest. We believe that a relevant, quality conversation elicits a quality response. Branded Research was founded in 2012 by a team of entrepreneurs from the data-driven world of market research and socially-driven world we inhabit today.




What You Will Be Doing

You will dive into our data to uncover insights, formulate and test ideas, and partner with stakeholders across multiple departments to help us understand and accelerate our consumer insights business.




Responsibilities for Data Analyst

Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Using statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets that could be helpful for the diagnosis and prediction
Analyzing local, national, and global trends that impact both the organization and the industry
Preparing reports for the management stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data
Working with programmers, engineers, and management heads to identify process improvement opportunities, propose system modifications, and devise data governance strategies.
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings




Qualification for Data Analyst

Comfortable in a complex data environment and understanding of data structures
Experience with Tableau, SQL, Python, panads, Jupyter Notebook, and Excel
Strong mathematical and statistical skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data
Knowledge of data visualization software like Tableau
Bonus: Experience with a coding language




Compensation & Environment

Competitive salary DOE and salary history, full benefits, and options. Branded Research operates in a very relaxed, flexible environment. Our chief concern is to produce high quality and well thought out work. Our second concern is that you are happy while doing it.
